sense.gloss: doxxing, doxing, making someone's private information public without permission
public humiliation (as an Edo period punishment)
to expose (to the sun, public, danger, etc.)
to doxx, to dox, to make someone's private information public without permission
to sentence someone to public humiliation
shopworn goods, dead stock, shelf warmer
being left unresolved for a long time (e.g. a problem), being shelved
leaving things exposed outside all night
pilloried criminal exposed to public view, public scorn or humiliation, person shamed in front of others

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑危険↑↓きけん↓に↑晒↑↓さら↓されていた。
↑今夜↑↓こんや↓、ここにたったとしても、↑自↑↓みずか↓らの↑命↑↓いのち↓を↑危険↑↓きけん↓に↑晒↑↓さら↓してアフガニスタンの↑山↑↓やま↓やイラクの↑砂漠↑↓さばく↓の↑中↑↓なか↓で↑起↑↓お↓きているアメリカ↑人↑↓じん↓がいることを↑我々↑↓われわれ↓は↑知↑↓し↓っている。
sdata.e: Even as we stand here tonight, we know there are brave Americans waking up in the deserts of Iraq and the mountains of Afghanistan to risk their lives for us.

sdata.j: いづれ↑白日↑↓はくじつ↓の↑下↑↓した↓に↑晒↑↓さら↓されるときが↑来↑↓く↓るだろう。
sdata.e: The time will come when it will see the light of day.

sdata.j: ↑晒↑↓さら↓し↑者↑↓しゃ↓にしてやる！

words.gloss: to expose (to the sun, public, danger, etc.)
